node.name: CLAIM 1.1.2:
node.description:
The abstraction (platform model)

is adequate representation

node.name: STRATEGY 1.1.2.1:
node.description:
Argue that chemokine

expression is adequately

captured in the simulation

node.name: CLAIM 1.1.2.1.1:
node.description:
Capturing one chemokine

is sufficient to capture

emergent behaviour

node.name: CLAIM 1.1.2.1.2:
node.description:
Levels of expression of

chemokines replicates that

in the biological system

node.name: Context:
node.description:
No quantitative data

exists at the current time

node.name: Justifications:
node.description:
1. LTi cells express two chemokine 

receptors, CXCR5 and CCR7 – the first

binds chemokine CXCL13, the second

CCL19 and CCL21 (Luther 2003, Ohl 2003)

2. Inhibiting CXCR5 significantly impacts

lymphoid organ development, whereas no

significant difference is observed when 

inhibiting CCR7

Significant difference

in PP formation if

CXCR5 inhibited

(Ansel 2000)

No significant

difference in mice

lacking receptor

CCR7 (Luther 2003)

Domain

Expert insight

node.name: STRATEGY 1.1.2.2:
node.description:
Argue that adhesion factor

expression is adequately

captured in the simulation

node.name: CLAIM 1.1.2.2.1:
node.description:
Capturing one adhesion

factor is sufficient to capture 

emergent behaviour

Significant difference

in PP formation if

VCAM-1 inhibited

(Finke 2002)

Domain

Expert insight

node.name: Justifications:
node.description:
1. LTin and LTi cells express two adhesion

receptors, α4β1 and α4β7, that bind to

VCAM-1, MAdCAM, and ICAM-1 expressed

by LTo cell (Yoshida 2001)

2. Inhibiting VCAM-1 expression has a

profound effect on aggregation, suggesting

it is dominant (Finke 2002)

node.name: CLAIM 1.1.2.2.2:
node.description:
Level of expression of

adhesion replicates that

in the biological system

node.name: Context:
node.description:
No quantitative data

exists at the current time

node.name: STRATEGY 1.1.2.3:
node.description:
Argue that the platform

representation of the gut

environment is appropriate

node.name: CLAIM 1.1.2.3.1:
node.description:
The physical shape of the gut

has no impact on PP formation

node.name: Assumptions:
node.description:
1. All cell interactions occur on the gut

epithelium

2. All LTin/LTi cell movement occurs on

the epithelium

3. Although aggregations can from as 3D

structures, having a 2D aggregation is a

suitable abstraction to judge what causes 

cells to aggregate  – it is the causes that 

are of interest, not matching the size

node.name: CLAIM 1.1.2.3.2:
node.description:
A 2D representation is suitable to

capture the emergent behaviours

Domain

Expert insight

node.name: STRATEGY 1.1.2.4:
node.description:
Argue that the abstractions made

concerning cell interaction do not

affect emergent behaviours

node.name: CLAIM 1.1.2.4.1:
node.description:
It is not necessary to explictly

capture lymphotoxin signalling

Domain

Expert insight

Cell behaviour

calibration results

(Figure 2.10)

node.name: Assumptions:
node.description:
1. RET signalling is thought to upregulate LTαβ

signalling on LTin cells – this occurs through

stable contact between an LTin and LTi, so is

implicitly included

2. No definitive understanding of how LTαβ

upregulated on LTi cells (Section 1.3.2) – just

that no PP form if not upregulated  (Adachi

1997) – assumption made the mechanism to

upregulate LTαβ is implicitly included
